byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and AMY CHOZICK

abstract: Hillary Clinton's advisers are grappling with best way to use Bill Clinton if and when she decides to run for president in 2016; are looking to avoid how Clinton's campaign used the former president in 2008 and are using that experience to build on successes and avoid potential pitfalls.
lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton’s advisers are trying to harness her husband’s gifts and rein in his impulses to avoid a repeat of her 2008 presidential campaign, when he was often a frustrated and unpredictable presence.

headline.main: To Avert Repeat of 2008, Clinton Team Hopes to Keep Bill at His Best
headline.print_headline: Clinton Team Hopes to Keep Bill at His Best
